title: Is there any bias here?
body:
Disclaimer:

I've never been much of a fiora fan but I was disappointed with her balancing and splash art during the rework. 

However, a while back Riot made a post explaining why they changed fiora's look the way they did and admitted it wasn't perfect. They went on to explain how they had made changes to it and that they acknowledged the player base's outcry at the (lets admit it) ugly splash art.

This post originally made me smile. Not only did it explain Riot's reasoning for what they did but they also admitted they did not exactly hit the nail on the head with Fiora's visual look.

But then.....

I though of another rework which bombed in both visual and gameplay terms and was hated before during and after the rework till this day by the champion's original player base. Thats right, I'm talking about {{champion:69}} .

In my opinion she's practically been ostracized by riot ever since her rework. It was a rushed, shoddy affair for the Shiruma event and most players in general will say she now sucks in game-play, balance issues, and lore/ champion identity.

SO WHERE IS THE POST FOR US CASSIOPEIA FANS? ......admittedly I can't expect riot to make a post about every mistake (which Cass's rework is), but it would be nice to see that they aren't picking favourite's when it comes to player feedback and rework attention. Morde is still getting attention but Cass is left in the dust.

I don't need a full scale rework to be happy, nor a promise of one in the future. 

However, it would be nice to know that since Fiora's rework, where only the art was an issue, got so much attention and change that maybe we can give some love to our favourite snake lady cause Stashu stomped her into the ground and we haven't seen anything about her since.

replies.body:
As the dude who wrote the Fiora post, I can maybe shed a tiny bit of light on some of this:

My job is telling stories about League and the work that goes on behind the scenes to keep it running, make new stuff, etc. Some of these stories will touch on tough topics like [Fiora](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/riot-games/editorial/champion-update-and-flawed-fencer) and [the recall bug](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/riot-games/editorial/total-recall-or-time-we-disabled-ranked), some will support new stuff like in-depth looks [at Foundations' Bilgewater work](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/special-event/building-bilgewater-pirate-renovation) or the way [artists think about animation](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/champions-skins/champion-update/dev-blog-animation-poppy). There's no conspiracy about Cass -- her update just happened a year before I got hired. 

I told the Fiora story because Fiora's was the first controversial thing that happened after I came onboard. We're making a big effort to do a better job of telling these stories, but it's unlikely that we'll have bandwidth to compile stories from years gone by. 

All that said, folks around here do hear feedback (and feel it in really personal ways). Plus, everyone loves the hell out of League. If you're feeling something (good or bad) about a specific champ, someone here is feeling the same thing because they main that champ or have hundreds of hours on him/her. I can't speak to any specific champion update since I don't work on champion updates (I know that's not the ideal answer, right?), but the one thing I can say for sure is that people here are very much paying attention.

Amazing that Riot actually hired a writer. I'd like to hear more about stuff happening behind the scenes!

So... uh... What are the juiciest rumors around there?

> [{quoted}](name=Vonler,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=KURh7sWR,comment-id=00030007,timestamp=2016-01-06T21:02:47.339+0000)
>
> Amazing that Riot actually hired a writer. I'd like to hear more about stuff happening behind the scenes!
> 
> So... uh... What are the juiciest rumors around there?

There are lots of writers! There are the narrative folks of course, but there's others who work on stuff like champ spotlights and dev blogs and promos and everything else that has words on it. It's actually kind of crazy how much text League requires.

As for juicy rumors... {{champion:37}}

> [{quoted}](name=Rumtumtummers,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=KURh7sWR,comment-id=000300070000,timestamp=2016-01-06T21:33:05.783+0000)
>
> 
> As for juicy rumors... {{champion:37}}

Juice rumors... Sona... "Only you can hear me summoner."

This is code for Rumtumtummers telling Vonler that he would message him personally in client and give him all the juicy rumors.

Obvious code is obvious.

... ;)

Ah I wish :P

Might have something to do with the new champion though.
Well she did get shot in the neck.

> [{quoted}](name=Rumtumtummers,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=KURh7sWR,comment-id=000300070000,timestamp=2016-01-06T21:33:05.783+0000)
>
> There are lots of writers! There are the narrative folks of course, but there's others who work on stuff like champ spotlights and dev blogs and promos and everything else that has words on it. It's actually kind of crazy how much text League requires.
> 
> As for juicy rumors... {{champion:37}}

Don't tease me like this...

Question: "there are lots of writers". So why don't we got 2-3 short canonic stories each week?
3 years ago, some red: "oh and do you know about that time Lissie lost her sight battling Volibear's girlfriend? Of course not, because this is one of the so many tales we're looking forward to tell you".
Took me like 10 minutes before I figured out what the last line meant {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}
NUUUUUUUUUUUU! Why U do dis!? Not mah main.....
How does one apply to be a writer for Riot?

I'm not trying to be negative or bash, I promise I'm not, but is there a reason you guys scrapped the Lee Sin rework, the heavy Riven changes, promised to revert the Kalista changes if they weren't meeting its goal, and continue to work on Mordekaiser diligently to make him healthy for both gameplay and playerbase, made changes to Fiora's visuals based on feedback, but {{champion:69}}  and {{champion:43}} didn't receive the same amount of love and delicacy?

I loved and embraced everything about the old Cassiopeia and Karma, and while they're forever gone and are not coming back, it kind of sucks that the playerbase for these two champions were neglected and brushed aside for other projects. :( I miss throwing fans, having true duality to my abilities (current Karma no longer has this yin and yang, offensive and defensive feel to her kit anymore). I miss being the beautiful temptress that corroded and destroyed her enemies from the inside out, little by little, until the time was perfect to go in for the kill via Twin Fang.

I honestly think the old kits were redeemable. Cassiopeia just needed a range reduction on Twin Fang to balance out her high lane bullying, since Noxious Blast was effective on its own. Karma was just too gold starved to be effective in the older seasons, but her old kit can work 110% in the current season and meta since gold starvation isn't a thing for supports now.

ofc that's not the ideal answer. Cassio was reworked on patch 4.16 , and now we are near to 6.1 and there was thousands of threads  with no real answers and just some   " yeah but no promises " and we still wait  ..
Highly upsetting that they are all gung-ho to fix mordekaiser nonstop but still won't make the slightest effort to fix cassio ... why ?? 
the player base had the same reaction and why cassio players should wait more / or get nothing ( thats what i think  ) 
and even for the design aspect  ( i think about the desperada skin )  if the skin team  have better things to do can they at least revamp her legacy skin : jade fang  meanwhile lulu's dragon trainer gets a revamp , lulu is not the lcs pick/ban since beta  no ... 
its sad on how riot can ignore for months ,   * for years a this point a " non played champ "  meanwhile instant revert the riven rework on pbe ... 
dont tell me there is no bias

Stashu should feel the feedback on his failed Cass rework personally. It has been a year now since he promised updates on Cass and he hasn't spoken about her since. He has spoken on other topics, like Fiora, but not a word on Cass. You can look in his post history and see him just go silent after making his promises. He doesn't even bother to update us to say that he is breaking his promise to work on Cass. That's unprofessional and rude.

Meddler said he pulled Stashu off Cass onto something else and just (Meddler) forgot to tell the player base. So the whole time people were waiting for an update, Stashu was "officially" done with Cass.

I'm fully aware of what Meddler said. There was nothing preventing Stashu from saying "Hey everyone, I'm no longer working on Cass". He didn't need to hide behind someone else. Stashu still hasn't said anything about Cass a full year later - not an apology for breaking his promise or for not even telling us that he was no longer working on Cass or even acknowledging her existence - even when he has been around, posting on other subjects.

While the answer is appreciated, you are perhaps the only Rioter I've seen that has responded to a Cassiopeia thread. So forgive me (and others) if it seems like no one is listening.

I never played Cassiopeia before her rework because I started playing after it happened. I do enjoy playing her now, but I can understand everyone's gripes. Her early game is trash to compensate for a "late game hyper carry" but even her late game isn't that good, especially with games ending sooner.

> All that said, folks around here do hear feedback (and feel it in really personal ways).

This is what stands out to me. If feedback is felt so strongly, if it's so clear that what's being done to a part of the game, that people are taking things to heart... Why then do we not see these things changed? 

The backlash for Cassiopeia was brutal. The backlash for promising to follow up on her and failing to deliver, was brutal. While it was definitely too harsh and *did* end up becoming very personal hatred for Stashu as a person for some... Why was it pushed through when it was met with extreme opposition every step of the way? It was all a very avoidable situation, and ultimately she's less fun to play, and still every bit a bully as she used to be. 

I predicted when she was reworked that she would come out with hugely inflated numbers to make her rework look like it was amazing, but that she'd be nerfed back down to obscurity shortly after, and that is exactly what happened, because her current kit cannot be balanced and more than the prior could. The only success the rework brought was angering the playerbase and hurting one of your employees.

> folks around here do hear feedback 

Hearing, and understanding are two different things. We see this is the stubborn Morde "is staying bot", and the "good enough" on the Fiora visual. Among others. Too often we see the same thing. Masteries/champion/items/ect are changed to "good enough" and then just left. We went over 6 months of waiting for Stashu to comment on Cass only to hear at the end of those 6 months Meddler say "oops, it was my call to move Stashu on to other projects and we just didn't update the players". 

Riot is still run like a small start up way too often for the largest (?) game in the world.

>Hearing, and understanding are two different things.

There's also a difference between understanding and _caring._

[Did you even read this thread?](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/EJRHGTlK-riot-theres-something-extremely-wrong-with-cassiopeia) It'd be a huge shame if all of that work was for nothing.

Also her stats have gotten even worse since then, she barely scratches 50% after 40 minutes now while having a 39-43% winrate during the first 25 minutes of the game, that's the average length of a regular game nowadays. She's worse off than ever before and you still don't act. How is that possible?

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/Y4sgQ4zT-warning-monster-post-contained-within-anyred

Is there a reason that we rarely ever get responses? You guys may feel it personally, but at least you can walk down the hallway and ask what they're working on, or send them an email or anything. 

Passionate mains of champs, or fans of lore, even someone whos ZZ'Rot's biggest fan are mostly left in the dark. I love your writing, and I work on my own to be like that someday. But when it comes to the passionate players outside of Riot, we get hurt and toxic because we get nothing in response. You may read or get our messages in a bottle, but it's frustrating to keep throwing them when it becomes apparent it's unlikely  if not {{champion:86}} teed that we won't hear a single thing back.

It's less about making huge (and very interesting) stories, and more about talking in the moment as things are happening. The Subnautica team is tiny compared to you guys, but they have public records and roadmaps and plans for what they are, and what they want to do. Why does Riot not do that?

> [{quoted}](name=Rumtumtummers,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=KURh7sWR,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-01-06T20:35:43.355+0000)
>
> All that said, folks around here do hear feedback (and feel it in really personal ways). Plus, everyone loves the hell out of League. If you're feeling something (good or bad) about a specific champ, someone here is feeling the same thing because they main that champ or have hundreds of hours on him/her. I can't speak to any specific champion update since I don't work on champion updates (I know that's not the ideal answer, right?), but the one thing I can say for sure is that people here are very much paying attention.

It doesn't feel like it at all. There doesn't seem to be much information about Riot hearing anything. Especially Cassiopeia since that rework was so long ago and we only recently heard even a single word about her since something like February 2015.

Dude, mad props on the recall bug story. It was amazing and I loved it. More like it please! :D

Are you planning on writing anything on Morde soon? I think it'd make a lot of people happy.

>All that said, folks around here do hear feedback 

considering everything red (which hadn´t been exactly much in the first place) that had been posted about preseason so far - it doesn´t feel like this in the slightest bit.

It's good to see Red posts, but dude, there are realistic, well-thought posts about core gameplay that are being ignored.  And in many of those posts, they often highlight how the skins and artwork posts get all the attention, but the gameplay posts are ignored.  

The fact that you posted in an artwork thread when there are actual gameplay threads above it that deserve Red attention simply highlights this fact.
Are you guys working on Fioras actual VU right now?

While it may not be the ideal answer, it is an answer nonetheless and I appreciate the response. It clears things up at least as to why Fiora got the post and Cass and Skarner etc. never did. 

Still disappointing that the snake lady has been left in the dust but I thank you for taking time out of your day to respond so cheers to you and hopefully to a more Poison snake filled future in league.

I know you're not part of the balance team, but you at least talked to them. What made them think of having % HP true damage that scales with AD? As much as I agree that she needs a way to take down tankier targets, the numbers on her vitals are so ridiculous that they, on average, hit unfair numbers such as 40% HP per vital, meaning that ulting a tank lets her blow them up. I remember somebody I played against got her up to 50% HP per vital strike, so two hits means that my 4k HP as a tank.

But the writing of her story was good, this time Fiora actually is shown to have a love for her family rather than looking down on her father.

It was funny when I saw the Fiora article about a botched Champion update, I was like damn Riot acting like Fiora was their biggest fuck up.
Meanwhile there are  {{champion:43}}  and {{champion:48}}  fans that are still pissed. Trundle had his entire unique identity ripped away from him in place of becoming a WoW troll, and karma .. uuhhhh honestly I'm not sure why they are mad something about fans?

At least with the writer chiming it it appears to be just him being relatively new blood not Riot trolling the fuck out of them

{{champion:43}}  is a tricky subject since it's a completely different experience for those that played her before the rework vs. the people that joined later or never noticed her. 

Old Karma was a calm, composed diplomat type with a yin-yang like theme to her spells (not to mention the unique shield-nuke mechanic with Mantra and an actually good heal in an era where Riot nerfed healing into the ground). 

New Karma is just a completely different and much angrier character for some reason. Some are upset because her unique characterization is gone, some are upset because the classy lady that didn't need to shown skin now dresses a lot..skimpier and seems to have bigger boobs, and a lot of people just find her kit extremely boring and binary as nothing but a Q spam bot.

If new Karma is all you ever knew then you'd probably think she's fine now, but for a lot of us old Karma was hella fun and we feel like Riot could at least have put her in the free champ rotation before completely relaunching her (their justification was that no one knew who Karma was...which was completely Riot's own fault).

I enjoy the new Karma and she's one of my favorite Mid laners however just looking at videos from the past, I can see that her old kit was significantly better. She had options and wasn't just using R > Q the entire game. She was a champion who's gameplay revolved around your own playstyle and she had such an interesting kit with all 3 of her Mantra's being viable compared to now.

> [{quoted}](name=A Miss Fortune,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=KURh7sWR,comment-id=000500000000,timestamp=2016-01-07T01:07:59.813+0000)
>
> I enjoy the new Karma and she's one of my favorite Mid laners however just looking at videos from the past, I can see that her old kit was significantly better. She had options and wasn't just using R > Q the entire game. She was a champion who's gameplay revolved around your own playstyle and she had such an interesting kit with all 3 of her Mantra's being viable compared to now.

Her old kit played like Annie with less subtlety.

While her nuke combo did play a bit like Annie's where you'd hold at 3 stacks e and tibbers someone, she also had the bait mechanic of getting more AP base of how much health she was missing, giving good Karma's a nice Risk vs Reward system to play with.

> [{quoted}](name=Rot Panda,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=KURh7sWR,comment-id=00050000000000000000,timestamp=2016-01-07T11:26:06.305+0000)
>
> While her nuke combo did play a bit like Annie's where you'd hold at 3 stacks e and tibbers someone, she also had the bait mechanic of getting more AP base of how much health she was missing, giving good Karma's a nice Risk vs Reward system to play with.

New Karma's mantra -> tether has just as much bait potential.

Yea kinda, ~30% of your missing health and 260 + 90%ap over 2 seconds is nice, but not much to counter the 3 auto's from an ADC you'll take in that time.

Old Heavenly wave was 270 + 60% ap damage with a 135 + 5%(+2% per 100 ap) of missing hp heal. she had 73 or so ap at 40% hp from her passive in those days.

There's a huge bias at work here, you can bet on that. Cassiopeia is being treated like dirt when it comes to basically *everything*. 

Lore? Destroyed, merely 4 lines of text that portray her as a twodimensional character. Identity? The poison mage we once knew and loved is long dead. Gameplay? Binary as hell and gutted into unviability, left to rot since then. Skins? It's been 3 years already since Jade Fang Cass came out, also what the hell did they do to her Desperada skin? Her current classic splash and model aren't even accurate with each other. 

She doesn't even have a recall animation, for god's sake. That champion update was the laziest work I've seen so far. They truly couldn't care less about her, but they sure as hell care about Zed, Ahri, Lee & Co. She deserves a fullblown relaunch at this point, period.
Indeed I bought Desperada Cass before the rework. I should ask for my money back. I wanted a rattlesnake lamia, not an earth worm.

Refund? Riot already ditched that idea after lots of lame reworks.

They are like "sorry mate, not gonna happen, champion has been changed, not our problem now"

As much as we love her, I'm pretty sure that Riot is trying to delete her.

She needed so much help and then fell into bad luck when she got it.

Now they're trying to stuff her in the dumpster because they don't want to allot anymore resources into something so hard to fix. (Keep in mind, indie developers can flip their game on its head in one night, but it's too much for Riot).

I mean, look at this.

1. Raise her AP ratios for fuck's sake

2. New passive: Toxic Heart (or some shit): Enemies poisoned for 2 seconds consecutively take 10% more damage and deal 5% less damage. Stacks up to five times.

Done, off the top of my head.

Does Riot care?

Nope.

Well that's all and good in a business sense but why then, is Morde still getting looked at and Fiora getting a long explanation post.

Its bad public policy to keep a ruined product out in the market without any recompense or attempt to fix it. My car got a recall and fixed for free when its company screwed up. Why shouldn't the policy carry over to League which claims to be a company devoted to its players?

> [{quoted}](name=ScurvyNave,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=KURh7sWR,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-01-06T18:35:38.914+0000)
>
> Well that's all and good in a business sense but why then, is Morde still getting looked at and Fiora getting a long explanation post.
> 

People need to understand that morde gets so much work put into him not as a champion,but as an idea.

They tried(/are trying?) to make a melee work bot,it's something very different than what they've done so far and could set a very important precedent if they actually succeed in doing so,it's not so much that they are putting much work into morde,they are putting a lot of work in an experiment with melees(and maybe later mages?) working bot lane,they just happen to be doing so through morde.

> [{quoted}](name=Prince Cobalt,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=KURh7sWR,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-01-06T18:29:35.419+0000)
>
> As much as we love her, I'm pretty sure that Riot is trying to delete her.
> 
> She needed so much help and then fell into bad luck when she got it.
> 
> Now they're trying to stuff her in the dumpster because they don't want to allot anymore resources into something so hard to fix. (Keep in mind, indie developers can flip their game on its head in one night, but it's too much for Riot).
> 
> I mean, look at this.
> 
> 1. Raise her AP ratios for fuck's sake
> 
> 2. New passive: Toxic Heart (or some shit): Enemies poisoned for 2 seconds consecutively take 10% more damage and deal 5% less damage. Stacks up to five times.
> 
> Done, off the top of my head.
> 
> Does Riot care?
> 
> Nope.

the 1 is okay. but that passive is plain bullshit.

I think Cass's voice came out better, before she sounded like a stereotypical harpy trying to get people to say she's beautiful but at the same time, her new voice isn't that big of an upgrade with it trying too hard at conveying "I am a slimy weaselly manipulator".

I consider hew new voiceover to be a downgrade, she doesn't sound like a seductress anymore which usually is the perfect kind of personality for a lamia. She's just some sassy snakelady now. Heck, she doesn't even HISS anymore. How could they screw this up?

> [{quoted}](name=Canastus,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=KURh7sWR,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2016-01-06T21:49:51.083+0000)
>
> I consider hew new voiceover to be a downgrade, she doesn't sound like a seductress anymore which usually is the perfect kind of personality for a lamia. She's just some sassy snakelady now. Heck, she doesn't even HISS anymore. How could they screw this up?

Be thankful you aren't brazilian. Her old BR voiceover was much, much better than that we have now. The new Cassiopeia VO seems like it was made by an inexperienced voice actor.

there is HUGE bias in this Gameplay section. Nearly all threads complaining about a champion will be about an assassin.

Fortunately Riot is not a stupid company and doesn't listen to the many outcries of those who have less knowledge of the game, otherwise assassins would have around 20% winrates today.

Just here to say I very much disagree with you about Cassiopeia OP. I like her current state (in game, both play and look wise) and I feel how she was before was a big problem and needed to be changed. I also don't feel it was in any way shoehorned into the Shurima event. It makes perfect sense to combine a rework with a matching lore event and when done right it's a beautiful thing, like it was with the GP and MF reworks (not saying they're perfect balance wise, but overall great reworks).
